text: Lavina Frances Keough (March 13, 1927 – August 24, 2001)Social Security Death Index, 1935-2014. Social Security Administration. was an American baseball player who played with the South Bend Blue Sox club of the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League during the 1945 and 1946 seasons.Madden, W. C. (2005) The Women of the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League: A Biographical Dictionary. McFarland & Company. Keough wore uniform number 7, and made a pitching appearance in 1945.Madden, W. C. (2000) All-American Girls Professional Baseball League Record Book. McFarland & Company. She pitched only one inning and did not have a decision. Keough married Edward L. Pierson Jr., in 1945 in Sacramento, California. They had five children. She filed for divorce in 1969, citing cruel and inhuman treatment. The All-American Girls Professional Baseball League folded in 1954, but there is now a permanent display at the Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum at Cooperstown, New York since November 5, 1988 that honors those who were part of the league. Lavina Keough, along with the rest of the girls and the league staff, is included at the display/exhibit.Before A League of Their Own. National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum. title: Lavina Keough
